IP2025039_syn_1:
Indication: Carinal SCC, obstruction.
Proc: Rigid bronch, Debulk (Mechanical/APC), Y-Stent.
Details: 80% obstruction distal trachea/carina. Debulked. 14x60/40mm Y-stent placed.
Comp: Desat during deployment.
Disp: ICU, intubated.
IP2025039_syn_2:
PROCEDURE: Rigid Bronchoscopy, Tumor Debulking, and Y-Stent Placement.
INDICATION: Malignant central airway obstruction.
NARRATIVE: Large squamous cell carcinoma involving the carina was visualized. Significant debulking was achieved using mechanical coring and APC. To maintain patency of the distal trachea and both mainstems, a silicone Y-stent was deployed. Patient required recruitment post-deployment due to desaturation.
IMPRESSION: Palliation of critical carinal obstruction.
IP2025039_syn_3:
Codes: 31641 (Tumor Destruction), 31631 (Tracheal Stent - Y stent counts as tracheal usually, or complex).
Note: Y-stent involves trachea and bronchi. Coding convention varies, usually primary stent code.
Technique: Rigid coring + APC.
IP2025039_syn_4:
Procedure: Rigid Bronch Y-Stent
Patient: [REDACTED]
Steps:
1. Rigid scope inserted.
2. Carina blocked by tumor.
3. Cored out tumor, used APC.
4. Placed Y-stent (Silicone).
5. Patient desatted, bagged up.
6. Stent looks good.
Plan: ICU intubated.
IP2025039_syn_5: Raymond Scott carinal tumor. rigid bronch to open it up. mechanical debulking and APC. put in a Y stent to cover trachea and both mains. he desatted during the placement but came back up. keeping him on the vent in the ICU.
IP2025039_syn_6: Central Airway Stenting Note. Procedures: Rigid bronchoscopy with tumor debulking, Y-shaped silicone stent placement. Patient: Raymond Scott. Findings: Bulky endobronchial tumor involving distal trachea and extending into both mainstem bronchi causing ~80% obstruction. Interventions: Mechanical debulking with rigid barrel and forceps followed by argon plasma coagulation. A custom 14 x 60/40 mm silicone Y stent was deployed. Disposition: Remained intubated postprocedure and transferred to ICU.
IP2025039_syn_7:
[Indication]
Malignant carinal obstruction.
[Anesthesia]
General, Rigid.
[Description]
Tumor debulked (Core/APC). Y-Stent placed (Trachea/RMS/LMS). Airway patent.
[Plan]
ICU, mechanical ventilation.
IP2025039_syn_8: [REDACTED] a large tumor blocking the split of his windpipe (carina). We performed an emergency procedure to open the airway. Using a rigid scope, we scraped away the tumor and burned the base. Then, we placed a Y-shaped silicone stent that holds open the trachea and both lung tubes. He had a brief drop in oxygen levels during the stent placement but recovered. He stays on the ventilator in the ICU for now.
IP2025039_syn_9:
Procedure: Rigid oncologic debulking and Y-prosthesis insertion.
Indication: Carinal asphyxiation syndrome.
Action: The endobronchial mass was excised and cauterized. A bifurcated silicone stent was positioned to scaffold the carina.
Result: Restoration of central airflow.
IP2025039:
Central Airway Stenting Note
Procedures:
1. Rigid bronchoscopy with tumor debulking
2. Y-shaped silicone stent placement
Patient: [REDACTED], 69-year-old male with squamous cell carcinoma of the carina causing severe central airway obstruction.
Anesthesia: General anesthesia with rigid bronchoscope and intermittent jet ventilation.
Findings: Bulky endobronchial tumor involving distal trachea and extending into both mainstem bronchi causing ~80% obstruction.
Interventions: Mechanical debulking with rigid barrel and forceps followed by argon plasma coagulation. A custom 14 x 60/40 mm silicone Y stent was deployed with the main limb in distal trachea and branches in right and left main bronchi.
Complications: Brief desaturation during stent deployment, resolved with recruitment.
Disposition: Remained intubated postprocedure and transferred to ICU.
